abstract: Personnel records of Fox Lake, Ill, policeman Charles J Gliniewicz, who staged his suicide to look like he had been murdered, show long history of misconduct and discipline; image emerging from records stands in sharp contrast to that of locally popular officer whose funeral attracted thousands of mourners.
lead_paragraph: An Illinois police officer who staged his suicide to make it look as if he had been murdered had a troubled job history, including numerous suspensions, sexual harassment allegations and complaints that he intimidated an emergency dispatcher with guns, according to his personnel records.

headline.main: Officer Who Staged His Death as Murder Had Troubled Work History, Records Show
headline.print_headline: Officer Who Staged His Death to Look Like Murder Had a Troubled Work History
